column1: LEGACY - this was not implemented exactly in this way. So tickets in https://github.com/geneontology/go-ontology/projects/7

column2: old_label
column3: new_label
column4: new_def
column5: old_def

column2: transcription factor activity, sequence-specific DNA binding
column3: transcription factor activity
column4: Direct regulation of DNA-templated transcription via sequence-specific DNA binding and selective, non-covalent interaction with elements of the transcription initiation complex or associated proteins. Associated proteins include any protein capable of interacting, directly or indirectly with the transcription initiation complex.
column5: Interacting selectively and non-covalently with a specific DNA sequence in order to modulate transcription. The transcription factor may or may not also interact selectively with a protein or macromolecular complex.

column2: bacterial-type RNA polymerase transcription factor activity, sequence-specific DNA binding
column3: bacterial-type RNA polymerase transcription factor activity
column4: Direct regulation of transcription by bacterial RNA polymerase via sequence-specific DNA binding and selective, non-covalent interaction with elements of the transcription initiation complex or associated proteins. Associated proteins include any protein capable of interacting, directly or indirectly with the transcription initiation complex.
column5: Interacting selectively and non-covalently with a specific DNA sequence in order to modulate transcription by bacterial-type RNA polymerase. The transcription factor may or may not also interact selectively with a protein or macromolecular complex.

column2: bacterial-type RNA polymerase transcriptional activator activity, sequence-specific DNA binding
column3: bacterial-type RNA polymerase transcriptional activator activity
column4: Direct positive regulation of transcription by bacterial RNA polymerase via sequence-specific DNA binding and selective, non-covalent interaction with elements of the transcription initiation complex or associated proteins. Associated proteins include any protein capable of interacting, directly or indirectly with the transcription initiation complex.
column5: Interacting selectively and non-covalently with a specific DNA sequence in order to activate or increase the frequency, rate or extent of transcription by bacterial-type RNA polymerase. The transcription factor may or may not also interact selectively with a protein or macromolecular complex.

column2: bacterial-type RNA polymerase transcriptional repressor activity, sequence-specific DNA binding
column3: bacterial-type RNA polymerase transcriptional repressor activity
column4: Direct negative regulation of transcription by bacterial RNA polymerase via sequence-specific DNA binding and selective, non-covalent interaction with elements of the transcription initiation complex or associated proteins. Associated proteins include any protein capable of interacting, directly or indirectly with the transcription initiation complex.
column5: Interacting selectively and non-covalently with a specific DNA sequence in order to stop, prevent, or reduce the frequency, rate or extent of transcription by bacterial-type RNA polymerase. The transcription factor may or may not also interact selectively with a protein or macromolecular complex.

column2: mitochondrial RNA polymerase transcription factor activity, sequence-specific DNA binding
column3: mitochondrial RNA polymerase transcription factor activity
column4: Direct regulation of transcription by mitochondrial RNA polymerase via sequence-specific DNA binding and selective, non-covalent interaction with elements of the transcription initiation complex or associated proteins. Associated proteins include any protein capable of interacting, directly or indirectly with the transcription initiation complex.
column5: Interacting selectively and non-covalently with a specific DNA sequence in order to modulate transcription by mitochondrial RNA polymerase. The transcription factor may or may not also interact selectively with a protein or macromolecular complex.

column2: RNA polymerase I transcription factor activity, sequence-specific DNA binding
column3: RNA polymerase I transcription factor activity
column4: Direct regulation of transcription by RNA polymerase I via sequence-specific DNA binding and selective, non-covalent interaction with elements of the transcription initiation complex or associated proteins. Associated proteins include any protein capable of interacting, directly or indirectly with the transcription initiation complex.
column5: Interacting selectively and non-covalently with a specific DNA sequence in order to modulate transcription by RNA polymerase I. The transcription factor may or may not also interact selectively with a protein or macromolecular complex.

column2: RNA polymerase II transcription factor activity, sequence-specific DNA binding
column3: RNA polymerase II transcription factor activity
column4: Direct regulation of transcription by RNA polymerase II via sequence-specific DNA binding and selective, non-covalent interaction with elements of the transcription initiation complex or associated proteins. Associated proteins include any protein capable of interacting, directly or indirectly with the transcription initiation complex.
column5: Interacting selectively and non-covalently with a specific DNA sequence in order to modulate transcription by RNA polymerase II. The transcription factor may or may not also interact selectively with a protein or macromolecular complex.

column2: RNA polymerase III transcription factor activity, sequence-specific DNA binding
column3: RNA polymerase III transcription factor activity
column4: Direct regulation of transcription by RNA polymerase III via sequence-specific DNA binding and selective, non-covalent interaction with elements of the transcription initiation complex or associated proteins. Associated proteins include any protein capable of interacting, directly or indirectly with the transcription initiation complex.
column5: Interacting selectively and non-covalently with a specific DNA sequence in order to modulate transcription by RNA polymerase III. The transcription factor may or may not also interact selectively with a protein or macromolecular complex.

column2: transcription factor activity, protein binding
column3: transcription regulator activity
column4: Direct regulation of DNA-templated transcription via selective, non-covalent interaction with elements of the transcription initiation complex or associated proteins. Associated proteins include any protein capable of interacting, directly or indirectly with the transcription initiation complex.
column5: Interacting selectively and non-covalently with any protein or protein complex (a complex of two or more proteins that may include other nonprotein molecules), in order to modulate transcription. A protein binding transcription factor may or may not also interact with the template nucleic acid (either DNA or RNA) as well.

column2: transcription factor activity, core RNA polymerase binding
column3: transcription regulator activity, core RNA polymerase binding
column4: Direct regulation of DNA-templated transcription via selective, non-covalent interaction with RNA polymerase core enzyme.
column5: Interacting selectively and non-covalently with an RNA polymerase in order to modulate transcription. A protein binding transcription factor may or may not also interact with the template nucleic acid (either DNA or RNA) as well.

column2: transcription factor activity, core RNA polymerase I binding
column3: transcription regulator activity, core RNA polymerase I binding
column4: Direct regulation of DNA-templated transcription via selective, non-covalent interaction with RNA polymerase I core enzyme.
column5: Interacting selectively and non-covalently with an RNA polymerase I (RNAP I) complex, typically composed of fourteen subunits, in order to modulate transcription. A protein binding transcription factor may or may not also interact with the template nucleic acid (either DNA or RNA) as well.

column2: transcription factor activity, core RNA polymerase II binding
column3: transcription regulator activity, core RNA polymerase II binding
column4: Direct regulation of DNA-templated transcription via selective, non-covalent interaction with RNA polymerase II core enzyme.
column5: Interacting selectively and non-covalently with an RNA polymerase II (Pol II) complex, typically composed of twelve subunits, in order to modulate transcription. A protein binding transcription factor may or may not also interact with the template nucleic acid (either DNA or RNA) as well.

column2: transcription factor activity, core RNA polymerase II recruiting
column3: transcription regulator activity, core RNA polymerase II recruiting
column4: Direct regulation of DNA-templated transcription via Interacting selectively and non-covalently with an RNA polymerase II (Pol II) complex, typically composed of twelve subunits, and with another protein, macromolecule, or complex, permitting those molecules to function in a coordinated way in order to facilitate the aggregation, arrangement and bonding together of proteins on an RNA polymerase II promoter DNA to form the transcriptional preinitiation complex (PIC). The formation of the PIC is a prerequisite for transcription by RNA polymerase.
column5: Interacting selectively and non-covalently with an RNA polymerase II (Pol II) complex, typically composed of twelve subunits, and with another protein, macromolecule, or complex, permitting those molecules to function in a coordinated way in order to facilitate the aggregation, arrangement and bonding together of proteins on an RNA polymerase II promoter DNA to form the transcriptional preinitiation complex (PIC), the formation of which is a prerequisite for transcription by RNA polymerase.

column2: transcription factor activity, core RNA polymerase III binding
column3: transcription regulator activity, core RNA polymerase III binding
column4: Direct regulation of DNA-templated transcription via selective, non-covalent interaction with RNA polymerase III core enzyme.
column5: Interacting selectively and non-covalently with an RNA polymerase III (Pol III) complex, typically composed of seventeen subunits, in order to modulate transcription. A protein binding transcription factor may or may not also interact with the template nucleic acid (either DNA or RNA) as well.

column2: transcription factor activity, ligand-activated RNA polymerase II transcription factor binding
column3: ligand-activated transcription regulator activity, RNA polymerase II transcription factor binding
column5: Combining with a signal and transmitting the signal to the transcriptional machinery by interacting selectively and non-covalently with an RNA polymerase II transcription factor, which may be a single protein or a complex, in order to modulate transcription. For example, some steroid hormone receptors bind to transcription factor complexes to regulate transcription of genes whose promoters do not contain hormone response elements.

column2: transcription factor activity, RNA polymerase I CORE element binding transcription factor recruiting
column3: transcription factor activity, RNA polymerase I CORE element binding, transcription factor recruiting
column4: Direct regulation of transcription by RNA polymerase I by interacting selectively and non-covalently with the CORE element, a regulatory region composed of the transcription start site and binding sites for transcription factors of the RNA polymerase I transcription machinery and also binding to an RNA polymerase I (RNAP I) transcription factor to recruit it to the transcription machinery complex .
column5: Interacting selectively and non-covalently with the CORE element, a regulatory region composed of the transcription start site and binding sites for transcription factors of the RNA polymerase I transcription machinery and also binding to an RNA polymerase I (RNAP I) transcription factor to recruit it to the transcription machinery complex in order to modulate transcription by RNA polymerase I.

column2: transcription factor activity, RNA polymerase I transcription factor binding
column3: transcription regulator activity, RNA polymerase I transcription factor binding
column4: Direct regulation of transcription by RNA polymerase I by selective, non-covalent interaction with an RNA polymerase I transcription regulator.
column5: Interacting selectively and non-covalently with an RNA polymerase I transcription factor, which may be a single protein or a complex, in order to modulate transcription. A protein binding transcription factor may or may not also interact with the template nucleic acid (either DNA or RNA) as well.

column2: transcription factor activity, RNA polymerase I transcription factor recruiting
column3: transcription regulator activity, RNA polymerase I transcription factor recruiting
column4: Direct regulation of transcription by RNA polymerase I via selective, non-covalent interaction with an RNA polymerase I transcription regulator.
column5: The function of binding to an RNA polymerase I (RNAP I) transcription factor and recruiting it to the transcription machinery complex in order to modulate transcription by RNAP I.

column2: transcription factor activity, RNA polymerase II basal transcription factor binding
column3: transcription regulator activity, RNA polymerase II basal transcription factor binding
column4: Direct regulation of transcription by RNA polymerase I via selective, non-covalent interaction with an RNA polymerase I transcription regulator.
column5: Interacting selectively and non-covalently with a basal RNA polymerase II transcription factor, which may be a single protein or a complex, in order to modulate transcription. A protein binding transcription factor may or may not also interact with the template nucleic acid (either DNA or RNA) as well.

column2: transcription factor activity, RNA polymerase II transcription factor binding
column3: transcription regulator activity, RNA polymerase II transcription regulator binding
column4: Direct regulation of RNA  polymerase II transcription via selective, non-covalent interaction with an RNA polymerase II transcription regulator.
column5: Interacting selectively and non-covalently with an RNA polymerase II transcription factor, which may be a single protein or a complex, in order to modulate transcription. A protein binding transcription factor may or may not also interact with the template nucleic acid (either DNA or RNA) as well.

column2: transcription factor activity, RNA polymerase II transcription factor recruiting
column3: transcription regulator activity, RNA polymerase II transcription factor recruiting
column4: Direct regulation of RNA  polymerase II transcription via selective, non-covalent interaction with an RNA polymerase II (RNAP II) transcription factor, recruiting it to the transcription machinery complex.
column5: The function of binding to an RNA polymerase II (RNAP II) transcription factor and recruiting it to the transcription machinery complex in order to modulate transcription by RNAP II.

column2: transcription factor activity, RNA polymerase III promoter sequence-specific binding, TFIIIB recruiting
column3: transcription regulator activity, RNA polymerase III promoter sequence-specific binding, TFIIIB recruiting
column4: Direct regulation of RNA  polymerase III transcription via selective, non-covalent interaction with a specific DNA sequence motif in an RNA polymerase III (Pol III) promoter in order to recruit the Pol III recruiting factor TFIIIB to the promoter.
column5: The function of binding to a specific DNA sequence motif in an RNA polymerase III (Pol III) promoter in order to recruit the Pol III recruiting factor TFIIIB to the promoter.

column2: transcription factor activity, RNA polymerase III transcription factor binding
column3: transcription regulator activity, RNA polymerase III transcription factor binding
column4: Direct regulation of RNA  polymerase III transcription via selective, non-covalent interaction with an RNA polymerase III transcription regulator.
column5: Interacting selectively and non-covalently with an RNA polymerase III transcription factor, which may be a single protein or a complex, in order to modulate transcription. A protein binding transcription factor may or may not also interact with the template nucleic acid (either DNA or RNA) as well.

column2: transcription factor activity, RNA polymerase III transcription factor recruiting
column3: transcription regulator activity, RNA polymerase III transcription factor recruiting
column5: The function of binding to an RNA polymerase III (RNAP III) transcription factor and recruiting it to the transcription machinery complex in order to modulate transcription by RNAP III.

column2: transcription factor activity, RNA polymerase III type 1 promoter sequence-specific binding, TFIIIB recruiting
column3: transcription regulator activity, RNA polymerase III type 1 promoter sequence-specific binding, TFIIIB recruiting
column5: The function of binding to a specific DNA sequence motif in a type 1 RNA polymerase III (Pol III) promoter in order to recruit the Pol III recruiting factor TFIIIB to the promoter. For type 1 Pol III promoters, this requires both TFIIIA and TFIIIC.

column2: transcription factor activity, RNA polymerase III type 1 promoter sequence-specific binding, TFIIIC recruiting
column3: transcription regulator activity, RNA polymerase III type 1 promoter sequence-specific binding, TFIIIC recruiting
column5: The function of binding to a specific DNA sequence motif in a type 1 RNA polymerase III (Pol III) promoter in order to recruit the transcription factor TFIIIC to the promoter.

column2: transcription factor activity, RNA polymerase III type 2 promoter sequence-specific binding, TFIIIB recruiting
column3: transcription regulator activity, RNA polymerase III type 2 promoter sequence-specific binding, TFIIIB recruiting
column5: Interacting selectively and non-covalently with a specific DNA sequence motif in a type 2 RNA polymerase III (Pol III) promoter in order to recruit TFIIIB to the promoter. For type 2 Pol III promoters, this requires TFIIIC activity.

column2: transcription factor activity, RNA polymerase III type 3 promoter TFIIIB recruiting
column3: transcription regulator activity, RNA polymerase III type 3 promoter TFIIIB recruiting
column5: The function of binding to a specific DNA sequence motif in a type 3 RNA polymerase III (Pol III) promoter in order to recruit TFIIIB to the promoter. For type 3 Pol III promoters, this requires SNAPc activity.

column2: transcription factor activity, sequence-specific DNA binding transcription factor recruiting
column3: transcription regulator activity, sequence-specific DNA binding transcription factor recruiting
column5: The function of binding to a specific DNA sequence and recruiting another transcription factor to the DNA in order to modulate transcription. The recruited factor may bind DNA directly, or may be colocalized via protein-protein interactions.

column2: transcription factor activity, TFIIA-class binding
column3: transcription regulator activity, TFIIA-class binding
column4: Direct regulation of DNA-templated transcription via selective, non-covalent interaction with a a basal RNA polymerase II transcription factor of the TFIIA class.
column5: Interacting selectively and non-covalently with a basal RNA polymerase II transcription factor of the TFIIA class in order to modulate transcription. The transcription factor may or may not also interact selectively with DNA as well.

column2: transcription factor activity, TFIIB-class binding
column3: transcription regulator activity, TFIIB-class binding
column4: Direct regulation of DNA-templated transcription via selective, non-covalent interaction with a a basal RNA polymerase II transcription factor of the TFIIB class.
column5: Interacting selectively and non-covalently with a basal RNA polymerase II transcription factor of the TFIIB class in order to modulate transcription. The transcription factor may or may not also interact selectively with DNA as well.

column2: transcription factor activity, TFIID-class binding
column3: transcription regulator activity, TFIID-class binding
column4: Direct regulation of DNA-templated transcription via selective, non-covalent interaction with a a basal RNA polymerase II transcription factor of the TFIID class.
column5: Interacting selectively and non-covalently with a basal RNA polymerase II transcription factor of the TFIID class in order to modulate transcription. The transcription factor may or may not also interact selectively with DNA as well.

column2: transcription factor activity, TFIIE-class binding
column3: transcription regulator activity, TFIIE-class binding
column4: Direct regulation of DNA-templated transcription via selective, non-covalent interaction with a a basal RNA polymerase II transcription factor of the TFIIE class.
column5: Interacting selectively and non-covalently with a basal RNA polymerase II transcription factor of the TFIIE class in order to modulate transcription. The transcription factor may or may not also interact selectively with DNA as well.

column2: transcription factor activity, TFIIE-class transcription factor recruiting
column3: transcription regulator activity, TFIIE-class transcription factor recruiting
column5: Interacting selectively and non-covalently with a basal RNA polymerase II (RNAP II) transcription factor of the TFIIE-class in order to recruit it to the RNAP II preinitiation complex (PIC) in order to modulate transcription by RNAP II.

column2: transcription factor activity, TFIIF-class transcription factor binding
column3: transcription regulator activity, TFIIF-class transcription factor binding
column4: Direct regulation of DNA-templated transcription via selective, non-covalent interaction with a a basal RNA polymerase II transcription factor of the TFIIF class.
column5: Interacting selectively and non-covalently with a basal RNA polymerase II transcription factor of the TFIIF class in order to modulate transcription. The transcription factor may or may not also interact selectively with DNA as well.

column2: transcription factor activity, TFIIF-class transcription factor recruiting
column3: transcription regulator activity, TFIIF-class transcription factor recruiting
column5: Interacting selectively and non-covalently with a basal RNA polymerase II (RNAP II) transcription factor of the TFIIF-class in order to recruit it to the RNAP II preinitiation complex (PIC) in order to modulate transcription by RNAP II.

column2: transcription factor activity, TFIIH-class binding
column3: transcription regulator activity, TFIIH-class binding
column4: Direct regulation of DNA-templated transcription via selective, non-covalent interaction with a a basal RNA polymerase II transcription factor of the TFIIH class.
column5: Interacting selectively and non-covalently with a basal RNA polymerase II transcription factor of the TFIIH class in order to modulate transcription. The transcription factor may or may not also interact selectively with DNA as well.

column2: transcription factor activity, TFIIH-class transcription factor recruiting
column3: transcription regulator activity, TFIIH-class transcription factor recruiting
column5: Interacting selectively and non-covalently with a basal RNA polymerase II (RNAP II) transcription factor of the TFIIH-class in order to recruit it to the RNAP II preinitiation complex (PIC) in order to modulate transcription by RNAP II.

column2: transcription factor activity, transcription factor binding
column3: transcription regulator activity, transcription regulator binding
column4: Direct regulation of DNA-templated transcription via selective, non-covalent interaction with another transcription regulator (cofactor, transcription factor).
column5: Interacting selectively and non-covalently with a specific transcription factor, which may be a single protein or a complex, in order to modulate transcription. A protein binding transcription factor may or may not also interact with the template nucleic acid (either DNA or RNA) as well.

column2: transcription factor activity, transcription factor recruiting
column3: transcription regulator activity, transcription regulator recruiting
column4: Direct regulation of DNA-templated transcription via a selective, non-covalent interaction with another transcription regulator (cofactor, transcription factor) the recruits the transcription regulator to the transcription machinery complex.
column5: Interacting selectively and non-covalently with a specific transcription factor, which may be a single protein or a complex, and with another protein, macromolecule, or complex, recruiting that specific transcription factor to the transcription machinery complex and thus permitting those molecules to function in a coordinated way, in order to modulate transcription. A protein binding transcription factor may or may not also interact with the template nucleic acid (either DNA or RNA) as well.
